ygData.subject: Re: EQ Survey
ygData.msgSnippet: ... 21 ... Male ... Since January of 2000. (15 Months) ... Yes. ... I had on-line friends who recommended I play.  I started in order to join them in the game.
ygData.messageBody:
>
>http://qlink.queensu.ca/~7jss1/eqsurvey.htm
>
>How old are you?

21

>Are you male or female?

Male

>How long have you been playing Everquest?
Since January of 2000. (15 Months)


>Is Everquest the first on-line roleplaying game you've played?

Yes.

>Why did you start playing Everquest?

I had on-line friends who recommended I play. I started in order to join
them in the game.


>Avatar questions
>
>What level, race, class, gender is your main avatar?

45 Gnome Wizard Male

>Do you have secondary avatars?

Yes

>What levels, races, classes, genders are your secondary avatars?

12 Troll Shadowknight Male
8 Gnome Rogue Male
7 Iksar Necromancer Male

>Why did you choose the classes you did for your avatars?

I chose Wizard because of what I read on fansites before I joined. I chose
Wizard to be the master of magical damage.
I chose a Rogue because I needed it's sneak skill to multi-quest for a
spell for my Wizard. I have yet to do the multi-quest, but like the class.
I chose Necromancer just to try out the class that everyone was talking
about at the time I created it.

>Do you play on a PvP server?

No.

>Are you in a guild?

Yes.

>For what reasons are you in a guild (or alternatively for what
>reasons are you not in a guild)?

To be able to converse with people I know in the game world easily. To be
able to find groups to play with and friends to talk with more easily.

>Do you attend guild events?

Yes, sometimes.

>Do you plan to ahead of time to attend guild events?

Occassionally.

>Do you normally group with
>
>1) People you meet that session
>2) People you knew prior to playing Everquest
>3) People you met through Everquest
>4) Guildmate you found in your area
>5) Other (please specify)

A combination of all. Sometimes it's 2, sometimes it's 3, sometimes it's
4, and sometimes it's 1. It depends where I am. I suppose I would answer
3 as the most common, but it's close.

>Have your grouping patterns changed as you've gained experience at
>the game? How so?

Yes. I initially grouped most often with 1 - people I meet that
session. Then as I got more powerful and could move around I grouped with
mostly 2 - people I knew prior to everquest. Then as I got more powerful
and met more people and entered a guild I grouped with mostly 3 - people I
met in game. Now I group with whatever fits my mood, or nobody.

>Time questions
>
>How many hours a week (on average) do you play Everquest?

Well, when I started I would say about 40. Now I would say maybe 6. But
it fluctuates. I will go a couple of weeks where it is closers to zero,
and other weeks where it's 6, and others where it's 20.

>How many hours do you play each session?

Usually if I'm logging in my primary, about 4. But if I only plan on
having a little bit of time I will play an 'alt'.

>How do you normally spend your time in Norrath?

Hunting creatures for experience, or sometimes questing, and occasionally
doing trade skills.

>Are you on a constant quest to level or do you take time off from
>gaining experience while playing?

I will take time off, like I will do a week of hardcore experience-gaining,
followed by a week of questing/trade skills, followed by a few weeks of
nearly not playing at all. Rinse, repeat!

>What do you do when you take time off from the mobs?

Trade skills and class-specific quests. My tradeskills are Tinkering,
Blacksmithing (as 2 primary ones) and Tailoring, Brewing, Baking.

>While trying to level do you ever take time out to help others?

Yes.

>If yes (to the previous question), in what ways?

I'll teleport others sometimes (and sometimes for profit too). I'll bind
newbies and give them stuff I don't really need. I'll powerlevel newbies
for an hour here or there.

>Did you know the other avatars prior to helping them?

Not necessarily.

>Can you give any reasons why you chose to help others?

Because it's fun in it's own way, and rewarding. It's both a chance to
help someone else, and to show off your power.

>Have you ever died helping others (outside of a group situation)?

Not that I can think of.

>Calls for help
>
>Do you ever help newbies?

Yes.

>If yes (to the previous question), how do you help newbies?

Same as how I help people out. Teleports, powerlevelling, train-breaking,
twinking.

>Can you give any reasons why you helped them?

Fun and showing off.

>Were you helped as a newbie? (This does not include help from friends
>you met prior to playing)

A little bit, yes.

>If yes (to the previous question), how were you helped?

People saved my butt from dying a few times.

>Do you respond to the /yell command?

Yes, if I'm not occupied.

>Does your respose to a plea for help depend on any factors? What are
>those factors?

If someone is polite and articulate.

>Are you more likely to help members of a specific race? gender?
>class? Why?

Nope. Because people lie about who they are and what sex they are
anyhow. I just judge people on how they act toward me. If someone plays a
really funny male Troll I'm just as likely to help him out as I am a female
woodelf character. In fact, perhaps more likely, because the female
woodelf is more likely to be a male using the sexualization of an avatar
for profit.

>Was there any time in your avatars life when you were more likely to
>help others?

No.

>If yes (to the previous question), what brought about the difference
>in game play?

N/A.

>Why do you think that people help others in Everquest?

Because they want to show off their power and they want to be respected.





Feel free to contact me if you need more information.
